intro: Thlaspi brevicaule, commonly known as the broadleaf winter cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are broadly ovate to round, with a waxy coating, and small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Thlaspi brevicaule is known for its ability to tolerate cold temperatures and is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa.
